responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure Handling of Arbitrary HTML
    analysis: |
      The inclusion of `innerHTML` in JavaScript is prone to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. Directly assigning or modifying HTML content using `innerHTML` can result in the execution of arbitrary scripts embedded in the HTML markup. This can lead to the manipulation of the DOM and potentially allow an attacker to load malicious scripts.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - src/main/resources/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/stapler/jstree/js/jquery.jstree.js
      - src/main/resources/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/stapler/colorbox/js/jquery.colorbox.js
    classification: very promising
  
  - headline: Insecure Permissions and Error Reporting
    analysis: |
      Using permissions incorrectly or overly informative error messages can expose sensitive operational details or facilitate unauthorized system access. This can result in privilege escalation or sensitive data exposure. Validating checks and permissions, especially regarding user input or access control, is essential to maintaining secure operations within the codebase.
    cwe: CWE-209
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/ImageGalleryRecorder.java
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/ImageGallery.java
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/imagegallery/ArchivedImagesGallery.java
    classification: very promising
  
  - headline: Potential Out-of-Bounds Array Index
    analysis: |
      Certain parts of this code lack proper validation of array indices and boundaries before performing operations based on those indices, leading to potential out-of-bounds read/write vulnerabilities. Functions that rely on arrays or indices must validate those indices properly to prevent accessing invalid array locations which could lead to crashes or data corruption.
    cwe: CWE-129
    function_names:
      - load_node
      - get_children
      - addToBranch
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/ImageGalleryRecorder.java
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/comparative/FilePairTree.java
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/imagegallery/comparative/ComparativeArchivedImagesGallery.java
    classification: slightly promising 
```

leads.headline: Insecure Handling of Arbitrary HTML
leads.analysis: The inclusion of innerHTML in JavaScript is prone to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. Directly assigning or modifying HTML content using innerHTML can result in the execution of arbitrary scripts embedded in the HTML markup. This can lead to the manipulation of the DOM and potentially allow an attacker to load malicious scripts.

leads.headline: Insecure Permissions and Error Reporting
leads.analysis: Using permissions incorrectly or overly informative error messages can expose sensitive operational details or facilitate unauthorized system access. This can result in privilege escalation or sensitive data exposure. Validating checks and permissions, especially regarding user input or access control, is essential to maintaining secure operations within the codebase.

leads.headline: Potential Out-of-Bounds Array Index
leads.analysis: Certain parts of this code lack proper validation of array indices and boundaries before performing operations based on those indices, leading to potential out-of-bounds read/write vulnerabilities. Functions that rely on arrays or indices must validate those indices properly to prevent accessing invalid array locations which could lead to crashes or data corruption.
